channel.title: ZDNet News - Front Door
channel.description: ZDNet delivers information resources for IT professionals.

item.title: Motorola to offer even slimmer phone
item.description: A new range of slim cell phones is planned for release next year, including a super-thin model.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, for Reuters

item.title: Mobile-TV vendors politely jockey for position
item.description: TV on mobile phones is still new enough to support many approaches, as carriers push to get short videos onto phones.
item.dc:creator: Tom Krazit, for News.com

item.title: Microsoft primes PC buyers for Premium Vista
item.description: Forget Vista Basic. Microsoft's marketing campaign will pitch hard for people to choose the higher-end Windows update.
item.dc:creator: Joris Evers, for News.com

item.title: Allchin: Still worried about Vista
item.description: Man behind development of newest Windows says there's still plenty of work to do before shipment.
item.dc:creator: Ina Fried, for News.com

item.title: Europe: No patents for software
item.description: Apparent U-turn on the extent to which software can be patented leaves patent opponents scratching their heads.
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Marson, for ZDNet (UK)

item.title: $100 laptop gets working prototype
item.description:
Nicholas Negroponte's One Laptop Per Child project shows off a vivid orange PC and trims its software load.
Photos: Laptop model sees orange
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Skillings, for News.com

item.title: AOL eyes broadband and advertising
item.description: Time Warner unit to launch new search function targeting high-speed connections, CEO says.
item.dc:creator: Elinor Mills, for News.com

item.title: Mozilla CEO: Why we're still shunned by corporate IT
item.description: Businesses still stick with proprietary technology, although Mozilla offers customization kit for business customers.
item.dc:creator: Sylvia Carr, for Silicon.com

item.title: Microsoft lays plans for 'Vistagami' tablets
item.description: Successor to Origami will look like the Windows XP-based tablet PC, but run the Vista update and hopefully cost less.
item.dc:creator: Ina Fried, for News.com

item.title: Sales of LCD TVs going like crazy
item.description: Shipments of liquid crystal display televisions jump in the first quarter, along with revenue.
item.dc:creator: Michael Kanellos, for News.com

item.title: Net neutrality fans pressure U.S. Senate
item.description: As hearing on Republican-backed telecom bill nears, Net neutrality proponents bid for stiff regulations.
item.dc:creator: Declan McCullagh, for News.com

item.title: TiVo, EchoStar both claim victory in patent ruling
item.description: Patent Office reviews 61 patents covering digital video recording technology as part of an ongoing lawsuit.
item.dc:creator: Candace Lombardi, for News.com

item.title: Vonage shares slide on first day
item.description: Stock down more than 14 percent after first day of trading, indicating investor wariness.
item.dc:creator: Marguerite Reardon, for News.com

item.title: Semantic Web ready for mainstream use
item.description: All the technologies are now in place to make the data-driven Web a reality, according to Tim Berners-Lee.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Bennett, for Builder UK

item.title: Google, Yahoo, eBay, Microsoft--which will merge?
item.description: Competition among the four is intensifying, and JPMorgan analysts are predicting at least a strategic partnership.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, for Reuters

item.title: A car that slows you down
item.description: In London, cars could be fitted with tech that automatically limits the engine when exceeding the speed limit.
item.dc:creator: Steve Ranger, for Silicon.com

item.title: Hundreds arrested in mass-marketing frauds
item.description: More than 565 people have been arrested over the past year as part of a global operation targeting mass-marketing fraud.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, for Reuters

item.title: Microsoft, NEC to share patents, expand server ties
item.description: NEC to supply hardware, Microsoft communication and business software as they develop products for corporate customers.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, for Reuters

item.title: Legoland champ triumphs in trial by fire--and ice
item.description:
Search for new master builder ends with a fire-breathing snowman beating a dragon, a spaceship and three blind mice.
Photos: Crowning the newest Lego master
item.dc:creator: Daniel Terdiman, for News.com

item.title: AMD: Vista only a tiny step to convergence
item.description: PCs have a way to go, despite advances in hardware and software aimed to bring PC technology into the living room.
item.dc:creator: Joris Evers, for News.com
